Description: COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P23AS00173FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICAS HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM. ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY.FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA.  COST-SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66. THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY.REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSTO PRESERVE THE CULTURAL RESOURCES OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR AND TO AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS TO HELP PRESERVE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE HISTORIC SITES RELATED TO THE ROUTES PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANCE (1926-1985). IT ALSO ASSISTS PRESERVATION PLANNING, RESEARCH, AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, AND SERVES AS A CLEARINGHOUSE FOR PRESERVATION INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO CREATE A DIGITAL PHOTO COLLECTION OF ROUTE 66 IN NEW MEXICO, A DATABASE, A LONG-TERM ONLINE EXHIBITION UTILIZING MULTI-MEDIA RESOURCES, AND AN ARCHIVE TO BE PERMANENTLY STORED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO, CENTER FOR SOUTHWEST RESEARCH.SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SELECTION AND PROCESSING OF PHOTOS AND INTERVIEWS FROM PHASE 1 OF PROJECT, DEVELOPING A PROJECT DATABASE, RESEARCHING ADDITIONAL IMAGES AND VIDEOS FOR ONLINE EXHIBIT, AND PREPARATION, FINALIZATION AND PUBLIC RELEASE OF ONLINE EXHIBITION..THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ON THE TANGIBLE ARCHITECTURAL LEGACIES, SYMBOLISM, AND USE OF THE NEW MEXICO PORTION OF ROUTE 66 TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE CULTURAL, SOCIAL, AND ECONOMIC NARRATIVES OF THE MOTHER ROAD AND HOW THEY ARE REFLECTED IN THE CONTEMPORARY REALITY OF ROUTE 66 TODAY.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INTERSTATE, INTRASTATE, STATE, LOCAL, SPONSORED ORGANIZATION, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, INDIVIDUAL FAMILY, SMALL BUSINESS, PROFIT ORGANIZATION, PRIVATE ORGANIZATION, OTHER PRIVATE INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P23AS00173FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICAS HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM. ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY.FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA.  COST-SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66. THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY.REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSTO PRESERVE THE CULTURAL RESOURCES OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR AND TO AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS TO HELP PRESERVE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE HISTORIC SITES RELATED TO THE ROUTES PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANCE (1926-1985). IT ALSO ASSISTS PRESERVATION PLANNING, RESEARCH, AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, AND SERVES AS A CLEARINGHOUSE FOR PRESERVATION INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO CREATE A VIDEO SERIES CONSISTING OF SIX EPISODES TO BE TELEVISED ON CABLE TV, STREAMED ONLINE, OR VIEWED IN PERSON AT ROUTE 66 EVENTS AND EXHIBITS. EACH EPISODE WILL HIGHLIGHT A THEME AND INCORPORATE THE VOICES BEHIND THE CITYS HISTORIC NEON SIGNS.SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SELECTION AND PROCESSING OF PHOTOS AND INTERVIEWS FROM PHASE 1 OF PROJECT, DEVELOPING A PROJECT DATABASE, RESEARCHING ADDITIONAL IMAGES AND VIDEOS FOR ONLINE EXHIBIT, AND PREPARATION, FINALIZATION AND PUBLIC RELEASE OF ONLINE EXHIBITION.THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO PRODUCE AN ORAL HISTORY VIDEO SERIES TO DOCUMENT ALBUQUERQUES ICONIC ROUTE 66 NEON SIGNS AND THEIR STORIES. DISCUSSIONS WILL INCLUDE DESIGN EVOLUTION, SIGN PRESERVATION, CREATIVE PROCESSES USED TO MAKE NEON, AND NEONS IMPACT ON ALBUQUERQUE ART, CULTURE, AND COMMERCEPAST, PRESENT, AND FUTURE. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INTERSTATE, INTRASTATE, STATE, LOCAL, SPONSORED ORGANIZATION, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, INDIVIDUAL FAMILY, SMALL BUSINESS, PROFIT ORGANIZATION, PRIVATE ORGANIZATION, OTHER PRIVATE INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION.

REQUIREMENTS FOR COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENTS1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001902  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT  IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICA S HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM. ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY.FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA. COST-SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66. THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY.REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTS AND FUNDED MODIFICATIONSTHE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO SUPPORT OWNERS OF NEON SIGNS ALONG ROUTE 66 TO PRESERVE AND MAINTAIN THEM AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA.THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PRODUCE A 25-MINUTE INSTRUCTIONAL VIDEO THAT PROVIDES KNOWLEDGE ON THE TYPICAL CONSTRUCTION OF A NEON SIGN  NON-ANIMATED  AND ITS COMPONENTS AND ALLOWS A NOVICE TO TROUBLESHOOT AND DO SIMPLE REPAIRS WITH COMMON TOOLS.SPECIFIC   PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLANNING AND PRODUCTION OF VIDEO CONTENT, FILMING, PRODUCTION,   POSTPRODUCTION, AND DISTRIBUTION OF THE VIDEO FOR FREE ON ONLINE PLATFORMS.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE OWNERS OF HISTORIC NEON SIGNS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

REQUIREMENTS FOR COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENTS1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001902  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT  IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICA S HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM. ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY.FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA. COST-SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66. THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY.REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTS AND FUNDED MODIFICATIONSTHE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT TO RESTORE THE HISTORIC HI-WAY CAFE SIGN TO OPERATING CONDITION.SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE REPLICATION FABRICATION OF NEON TO MATCH HISTORIC LETTERING, FONT AND COLOR AS CLOSELY AS POSSIBLE  REPAIR AND RE-PAINTING OF SIGN BOX TO MATCH HISTORIC APPEARANCE AND COLORS AS CLOSELY AS POSSIBLE  CLEAN AND REPAINT SIGN POLE  REINSTALLING SIGN ON POLE  ESTABLISHING ELECTRICAL POWER TO THE SIGN.THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO COMPLETELY RESTORE THE HISTORIC HI-WAY CAFE NEON SIGN TO OPERATING CONDITION, AS PART OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE TRAVELING AND GENERAL PUBLIC.

TO PRESERVE THE CULTURAL RESOURCES OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR AND TO AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST-SHARE GRANTS TO HELP PRESERVE THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE HISTORIC SITES RELATED TO THE ROUTES PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANCE (1926-1985). IT ALSO ASSISTS PRESERVATION PLANNING, RESEARCH, AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, AND SERVES AS A CLEARINGHOUSE FOR PRESERVATION INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.THE PROJECT GOALS ARE TO SUPPORT THE INTENT OF PUBLIC LAW NO. 106-45, SECTION 2.3 WHICH STATES THE SECRETARY SHALL ASSIST THE STATES IN DETERMINING THE APPROPRIATE FORM OF AND ESTABLISHING AND SUPPORTING A NON-FEDERAL ENTITY OR ENTITIES TO PERFORM THE FUNCTIONS OF THE CULTURAL RESOURCE PROGRAMS AFTER THOSE PROGRAMS ARE TERMINATED.THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE FOR THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT TO WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP PARTICIPATION AND COLLABORATION ACROSS THE STATES FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESERVING, PROMOTING, RESEARCHING EDUCATING, AND REVITALIZING THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR. THIS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE ANNUAL MEETING OF RESEARCH ROUTE 66 AND OTHER SUPPORT NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE WORKING GROUP, PROJECT GOALS, AND OTHER GENERAL INITIATIVES.COLLABORATE ON THE ARRANGEMENT OF LOCAL LOGISTICS FOR AN ANNUAL ROAD AHEAD BOARD MEETING, THE PURPOSE OF THE MEETING IS TO BRING THE ROAD AHEAD BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TOGETHER TO ADVANCE THE STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND OPERATIONS OF THE ROAD AHEAD. COLLABORATE ON THE ARRANGEMENT OF LOCAL LOGISTICS FOR AN ANNUAL MEETING OF RESEARCH ROUTE 66,  THE PURPOSE OF THE MEETING IS FOR ROUTE 66 MUSEUMS, LIBRARIES, AND ARCHIVES TO COLLABORATE WITH THE ROAD AHEAD TO INCREASE AND PROMOTE RESEARCH AND EDUCATION ON ROUTE 66. COLLABORATE ON ONGOING ADMINISTRATION AND UPDATES TO THE RESEARCH ROUTE 66 WEBSITE. THIS MAY INCLUDE ONGOING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MAKE DESIGN MODIFICATIONS AND UPDATES TO THE SITE AS DEEMED NECESSARY.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INTERSTATE, INTRASTATE, STATE, LOCAL, SPONSORED ORGANIZATION, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, INDIVIDUAL FAMILY, SMALL BUSINESS, PROFIT ORGANIZATION, PRIVATE ORGANIZATION, OTHER PRIVATE INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION.

PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66  THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD REQUIREMENTS FOR COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENTS1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001902  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00190   FY 2022 ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAMIN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICA S HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM  ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR  COST SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66 REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTS AND FUNDED MODIFICATIONSTHE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RECORD AND DOCUMENT THE TOTAL BUILT ENVIRONMENT OF ROUTE 66 AS IT PASSES THROUGH TUCUMCARI, NM  DISTINCT AND COMPLEMENTARY DISCIPLINARY METHODOLOGIES INCLUDING GEOMATICS, PUBLIC HISTORY AND MEDIA STUDIES, ARCHAEOLOGY, AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION WILL ALL BE USED TO CREATE A FINAL PRODUCT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ONLINE PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE FIELD VISITS, LESSON DEVELOPMENT,   AND STUDENT INSTRUCTION IN GEOMATICS, PUBLIC HISTORY, MEDIA STUDIES,   ARCHEOLOGY AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION FOR THE PURPOSE OF CAPTURING HISTORIC   AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH PHOTOGRAPHY, VIDEO, DRAWINGS, AND GPS AND 3D SPATIAL DATA  THE   RESULT WILL BE A LAYERED, GEO CULTURAL HISTORY OF TUCUMCARI S ROUTE 66   LANDSCAPE AS IT HAS EVOLVED OVER TIME, AND A CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT PLAN    THE WORK WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH A WEB BASED PLATFORM AND WILL EXPLORE   BEST PRACTICES ON HOW TO RECORD THE PHYSICAL LANDSCAPE OF ROUTE 66 WHILE   PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN THE ON GOING CONSTRUCTION   OF THE PEOPLE S HISTORY OF ROUTE 66 THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO ENGAGE UNIVERSITY STUDENTS TO STUDY AND DOCUMENT ROUTE 66 CULTURAL LANDSCAPES AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER AND TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INTERSTATE, INTRASTATE, STATE, LOCAL, SPONSORED ORGANIZATION, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, OTHER PUBLIC INSTITUTION ORGANIZATION, FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENT, INDIVIDUAL FAMILY, MINORITY GROUP, SPECIALIZED GROUP, SMALL BUSINESS, PROFIT ORGANIZATION, PRIVATE ORGANIZATION, QUASI PUBLIC NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, OTHER PRIVATE INSTITUTION PROVIDES COST SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SURVEY AND DESIGNATE THE CONCRETE SECTION OF U S  HIGHWAY 66 BETWEEN HYDRO AND BRIDGEPORT, OKLAHOMA TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES AT THE STATE LEVEL OF SIGNIFICANCE  IT WILL ALSO EXPLORE ITS POTENTIAL FOR NATIONAL LEVEL DESIGNATION AND NOMINATE IT AT THAT LEVEL IF APPROPRIATESUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PLANNING, RESEARCH, CORRESPONDENCE, FIELD SURVEY, SURVEY SYNTHESIS, AND NOMINATION PREPARATION PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO ELEVATE THE NATIONAL REGISTER STATUS OF THE CONCRETE SECTION OF U S  HIGHWAY 66 BETWEEN HYDRO AND BRIDGEPORT, OKLAHOMA TO THE NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES AT THE STATE LEVEL OF SIGNIFICANCE  IT WILL ALSO EXPLORE ITS POTENTIAL FOR NATIONAL LEVEL DESIGNATION AND NOMINATE IT AT THAT LEVEL IF APPROPRIATE AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND PUBLIC AGENCIES RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION OF THIS SEGMENT OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00190FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICA S HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM  ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66  THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA  COST SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66  THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT, PRESERVE, AND MAKE ACCESSIBLE ORAL HISTORIES OF THOSE WHO EXPERIENCED WORK, LIFE, ENTERTAINMENT, AND TRAVEL ALONG THE STRETCH OF ROUTE 66 THAT ORIGINATED IN ILLINOIS AND RAN ACROSS THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF THE STATE FROM THE ROAD S CREATION IN 1926 UNTIL IT WAS DECOMMISSIONED IN 1985 SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COLLECTION AND ARCHIVING OF APPROXIMATELY 100 ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS, COLLABORATION TO INCREASE PUBLIC EXPOSURE AND USE OF THE ORAL HISTORIES, AND MAKING THE ORAL HISTORIES AVAILABLE ON THE INTERNET PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO CAPTURE THE MEMORIES AND STORIES OF THOSE WHO LIVED, WORKED, TRAVELED AND PRESERVED ROUTE 66 IN ILLINOIS AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, AND TO MAKE THIS INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE STATE OF ILLINOIS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00190FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT IN RECOGNITION OF THE SIGNIFICANCE OF ROUTE 66 TO AMERICA S HERITAGE, CONGRESS PASSED AN ACT IN 1999 TO CREATE THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM  ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, THE PROGRAM IS DEDICATED TO PRESERVING THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC HIGHWAY FIRST FUNDED IN 2001, THE PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, AND GOVERNMENT PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY, PRIORITIZE, AND ADDRESS PRIORITY PRESERVATION NEEDS OF ROUTE 66  THE PROGRAM PROVIDES COST SHARE GRANTS FOR THE PRESERVATION OF THE MOST SIGNIFICANT AND REPRESENTATIVE BUILDING, STRUCTURES, ROAD SEGMENTS, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES ALONG THE LENGTH OF THE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, COVERING ILLINOIS, MISSOURI, KANSAS, OKLAHOMA, TEXAS, NEW MEXICO, ARIZONA, AND CALIFORNIA  COST SHARE GRANTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR PLANNING, RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES RELATED TO THE PRESERVATION OF ROUTE 66  THE FUNDING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM EMPOWERS AND LEVERAGES THE PUBLIC TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SPECIAL PLACES AND STORIES OF THIS IMPORTANT ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO UPGRADE THE SEPTIC SEWER SYSTEM OF THE DECAMP STATION, IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS VIABILITY AS A THRIVING ROUTE 66 BUSINESS AND COMMUNITY CENTER IN STAUNTON, ILLINOIS SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE REMOVAL OF OLD SEPTIC SYSTEM, AND INSTALLATION OF NEW SYSTEM THAT IS UP TO CODE PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO MAINTAIN THE OPERATIONAL VIABILITY OF THE HISTORIC DECAMP STATION AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND ALSO THE TRAVELING AND GENERAL PUBLIC

PLUMBING AND ELECTRICAL SYSTEMS SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPLETE PLUMBING UPGRADES INCLUDING WATER LINES, SEWER LINES, TOILETS, FIXTURES, TUBS, SHOWERS, SANITARY DRAINS AND FLOOR DRAINS  NATURAL GAS LP LINES AND VENTING SYSTEMS  AND COMPLETE ELECTRICAL UPGRADES INCLUDING WIRING, ELECTRICAL BOX, ELECTRICAL PANEL, TRANSFORMER PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO RESTORE THE HISTORIC SHAMROCK COURT AS PART OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE TRAVELING AND GENERAL PUBLIC

ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPLORE ROUTE 66 THROUGH NEW MEXICO TO PROVIDE A REALISTIC AND COMPREHENSIVE VIEW OF THE CULTURAL, SOCIAL, AND ECONOMIC NARRATIVES OF THE MOTHER ROAD AND HOW THEY ARE REFLECTED IN ITS CONTEMPORARY REALITY SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC   PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH, PHOTOGRAPHIC SURVEY AND   ETHNOGRAPHIC RESEARCH   ACROSS ROUTE 66 IN NEW MEXICO PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE PERFORMANCE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO EXAMINE THE HISTORIC COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES STILL IN OPERATION, UNDERTAKE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH AND PHOTOGRAPHIC SURVEY OF THEIR TANGIBLE ARCHITECTURAL LEGACY AND CURRENT USE, ROUTE 66 ICONOGRAPHY, AND ETHNIC FEATURES FROM A CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGICAL PERSPECTIVE, CULMINATING IN THE CREATION OF A PHOTOGRAPHIC COLLECTION, A DETAILED DATABASE, AND A REPORT   BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE ACADEMIA AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC

ERA OF AMERICAN HISTORY REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE AN INTERACTIVE, MULTIMEDIA MAP OF ROUTE 66 IN CALIFORNIA  THE PROJECT WILL COLLECT AND ASSEMBLE EPHEMERA, PHOTOGRAPHIC SOURCE MATERIAL AND ORAL HISTORY TESTIMONY TO INCORPORATE INTO MULTIMEDIA MAPS  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO MODEL THE CONSTRUCTION OF SIMILAR KINDS OF MAPPING OF THE REMAINDER OF THE ROUTE TO CHICAGO  THE GOAL IS TO ESTABLISH A NATIONAL  AND REGIONAL SCALE NETWORK OF PARTNERS, COLLABORATORS, AND SUPPORTERS TO COMPLETE THE RT 66 PATHWAY PROJECT IN TIME FOR THE ROAD S CENTENNIAL CELEBRATION SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES SPECIFIC   PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ARCHIVAL RESEARCH, BOTH COMMUNITY   AND INSTITUTIONAL OUTREACH, DEVELOPMENT OF RT 66 DIGITAL 3D MAP UNDERLAYS IN   CALIFORNIA, FIELD WORK AND ORAL HISTORY COLLECTION, DEVELOPMENT OF PROTOCOLS   FOR PRODUCTION, CATALOGING, ASSEMBLING COLLECTED RESEARCH INTO 3D DIGITAL MAP,   3D DIGITAL MAP ASSEMBLY, PRINTS AND ONLINE PUBLICATION ON PATHWAYS PROJECT   WEBSITE, A SYMPOSIUM WEEKEND WITH PUBLIC PRESENTATIONS, PRINT EXHIBITION,   PARTNERS, AND COLLABORATORS WORKSHOP PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO CREATE AN UNIQUE, PUBLIC, INTERPRETIVE EXPERIENCE OF ROUTE 66 IN CALIFORNIA AS PART OF A LARGER NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION TO PARTNER WITH PRIVATE, NONPROFIT, EDUCATIONAL, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES TO PRESERVE AND COMMEMORATE THE SIGNIFICANT SITES AND STORIES OF THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR, IN ORDER TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING, PRESERVATION AND REVITALIZATION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66 FROM CHICAGO TO SANTA MONICA BENEFICIARIES THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE GENERAL PUBLIC

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  N AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT  N AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  AS PER PL 106 45, THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR PRESERVATION PROGRAM  NPS  HAS WORKED WITH THE EIGHT STATES THROUGH WHICH ROUTE 66 PASSES TO DETERMINE AND ESTABLISH A NONPROFIT ENTITY KNOWN AS THE ROUTE 66 ROAD AHEAD PARTNERSHIP  66TRA   THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES DIRECT SUPPORT TOWARD THE ONGOING DEVELOPMENT OF THE ENTITY SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT THE NPS AND 66TRA WILL WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP PARTICIPATION AND COLLABORATION ACROSS THE STATES FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESERVING, PROMOTING, RESEARCHING EDUCATING, AND REVITALIZING THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR  SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSIST WITH ORGANIZING AND HOSTING AN ANNUAL BOARD MEETING FOR THE PURPOSE BRINGING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TOGETHER TO ADVANCE THE STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND OPERATIONS OF 66TRAASSIST WITH ORGANIZING AND HOSTING ANNUAL MEETING OF RESEARCH ROUTE 66, FOR THE PURPOSE OF INCREASING AND PROMOTING RESEARCH AND EDUCATION ON ROUTE 66 OVERSEEING MIGRATION OF RESEARCH ROUTE 66 WEBSITE TO 66TRA ADMINISTRATIVE SERVER IMPLEMENTING A STRATEGIC FINANCIAL SUSTAINMENT PLAN PROVIDING TECHNICAL SUPPORT  INCLUDING TRAVEL  AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE TO STAKEHOLDERS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC ON ACTIVITIES RELATING TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND MISSION OF THE 66TRA INCLUDING WORK TO INCREASE AND ENHANCE STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS, AND FOR DEVELOPMENT OF TASK FORCE INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS ISSUES CHALLENGES FACING ROUTE 66 AND THE 66TRA PROVIDE OFFICE SPACE AND SUPPORT TO PERFORM THE ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES OF THE 66TRA PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES A   PERFORMANCE GOALS   PERFORMANCE GOALS ARE TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NON FEDERAL ENTITIES TO PRESERVE, PROMOTE, REVITALIZE AND EDUCATE ABOUT HISTORIC US 66 FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, LAND MANAGERS, LOCAL STATE FEDERAL TRIBAL AGENCIES AND OTHERS B  PROJECT OBJECTIVES   PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE FOR THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND THE ROUTE 66 ROAD AHEAD PARTNERSHIP TO WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP PARTICIPATION AND COLLABORATION ACROSS THE STATES FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESERVING, PROMOTING, RESEARCHING EDUCATING, AND REVITALIZING THE HISTORIC ROUTE 66 CORRIDOR  THIS WILL INCLUDE SUPPORTING THE ANNUAL MEETING OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, OPERATIONAL ACTIVITIES, CAPACITY BUILDING FINANCIAL SUSTAINMENT, AND OTHER SUPPORT NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE AGENCY, ORGANIZATIONAL, WORKING GROUP AND PROJECT GOALS, AND OTHER INITIATIVES BENEFICIARIES THIS WORK WILL ENGAGE AND BENEFIT BUSINESS OWNERS, COMMUNITIES, EDUCATORS, TRIBES, AND GOVERNMENT AGENCIES INVOLVED WITH PRESERVING AND PROMOTING THE HISTORIC CORRIDOR, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHO TRAVELS AND EXPERIENCES THE ROAD, BY PROVIDING A COLLABORATIVE ORGANIZING UNIT TO COORDINATE NATIONAL PRESERVATION, PROMOTION, RESEARCH EDUCATION, REVITALIZATION, AND OUTREACH EFFORTS ALONG THE ROUTE
